alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 8:38PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Carbon and central Albany Counties through 945 PM MDT... At 837 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Medicine Bow, or 45 miles northwest of Laramie, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Medicine Bow and Rock River. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin
